Posts.Content: ebarnes48 wrote: I have a mild form of lymphedema. I wear a sergical sleeve about 80% of the time.  twice now I have had a rash on my arm. The rash is just local to my arm I don't get it anywear else. I wasn't wearing my sleeve when it happened. my arm also get hot to the touch and gets a bit discoloured. our nurse prac, is at a loss as to why this happens. Anyone got any idea as to why this happens. Dx 10/21/2008, 4cm, Stage IIIA, 0/16 nodes, ER-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: why do I get this??????? ebarnes48 Binney4

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2010 07:11PM ebarnes48 wrote: Barbe I dont wear the false boob either, I am more comfy  without it,  I had my partners  teenage nephews and nieces laughing,  as I told them I had part of my halloween costume  when asked were  I'd stand up and turn side on and say look man then turn the other side and say look woman, my partner says my humour is dry and wierd, but you have to laugh  the BC is now part of me but its not taking me,
Posts.Title: What do you do to promote BC awareness? AnacortesGirl Joviangeldeb

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 02:33PM ebarnes48 wrote: I will talk to anyone about my experiance  with BC,  I saw the bra thing on face book didnt realise it was a cancer awareness thing I though my friend was just being her normal daft idiot *LOL*  we had an older lady in our comunity who was dx with BC and wouldnt go for the surgery, so I asked her daughter if it would help if I came down and spoke with her.  the daughter said it might help.  So with false boob in hand down I went, told her all that had happened to me showed her the boob and bra's you get. also at her request showed her the scare that was left..   I found out a few days later she had the op  with out any problems and was home.
Posts.Title: What do you do to promote BC awareness? AnacortesGirl Joviangeldeb

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2010 10:49PM ebarnes48 wrote: I am her 2 pos   my lump was 4 cms   I had 6 rounds of chemo first which started to shrink the lump after the first round  I had a massectomy  and 16 lymphnodes removed (none infected)  last march  and now am cancer free   I am having  18 rounds of herceptin  to reduce the risk of it returning al though they cant  say for sure it will not return.  I asked about the lumpectomy  but was advised it would be better  to have the mass as they would be more sure of removing it all, which by the time my chemo was over it had shrunk to nothing. I didnt have to have any radiation. my onc said the way I had my treatment was new ie:- chemo then surgery  it worked in my case. my cancer was also stage 3, so had been there a while,  I have a false boob but never wear it as I am more at ease walking around with one missing  when I wear the false boob  I think people are stareing at me and saying she has a false boob.  so talk to your onc ask why they are going one way  and not another ask as many questions as you can.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy vs Mastectomy mom2mms SATEX12

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2010 02:18PM - edited Jan 11, 2010 02:19PM by ebarnes48 my hair started to fall out 2 days after the first round, I was in the shower and just happened to look down and it was like a mat round my feet, all I could think of was I must get that before it goes down the plug hole.  I went and saw the hair dresser to have it all cut of  and when she finnished , I said OMG  she said very worried what?    I said I look just like my brothers omg. I have my brothers stareing at me when I look in the mirrors.  I ended up with every hair on my body gone and boy was that cold (live in Newfoundland ) this was right over winter.  my partner woke up one night and saw me sleeping there with a wooly hat on, she woke me up laughing I said well I was cold and this kept me warm. the hair started growing back about a month after the last chemo, and curly  had straight hair before.
